util.graph

Class Graphs

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.graph.Graphs

  • public final class Graphs
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides a lot of utility methods for working with graphs

    • Method Detail

      • componentMapping

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E>> int[] componentMapping(int vertices,
                                                                     java.lang.Iterable<E> edges)
        Returns an array representing a connected component mapping. The i-th entry is the index of the connected component which the i-th vertex is part of
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges in the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges in the graph
        Parameters:
        vertices - the number of vertices in the graph
        edges - an Iterable of all edges in the graph
        Returns:
        an array representing a connected component mapping as described above

      • componentMapping

        public static int[] componentMapping(int vertices,
                                     java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> components)
        Creates an array representing a connected component mapping. The i-th entry is the index of the connected component which the i-th vertex is part of
        Parameters:
        vertices - the number of vertices in the graph
        components - a List of List of Integer where the i-th List contains the indices of all vertices that belong to the i-th component
        Returns:
        an array representing a connected component mapping as described above

      • components

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E>> java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> components(int vertices,
                                                                                                           java.lang.Iterable<E> edges)
        Takes a graph specified by a number of vertices and an Iterable of edges and returns a List of List of Integer, where the i-th List contains the indices of all vertices that belong to the i-th connected component.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        Parameters:
        vertices - the number of vertices of the graph
        edges - an Iterable of edges of the graph
        Returns:
        a List of List of Integer representing the connected components of the graph as described above

      • sortEdges

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E>> EdgeList<E> sortEdges(int vertices,
                                                                    java.lang.Iterable<E> edges)
        Takes a graph specified by the number of vertices and an Iterable of edges and returns an EdgeList containing all edges in a sorted manner.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        Parameters:
        vertices - the number of vertices in the graph
        edges - an Iterable of edges in the graph
        Returns:
        an EdgeList containing all edges of the original graph, but sorted

      • removeDuplicates

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E> & java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> EdgeList<E> removeDuplicates(int vertices,
                                                                                                             java.lang.Iterable<E> edges)
        Removes multiple edges between two vertices. If there are multiple edges between two vertices, only the lightest edge is kept.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        Parameters:
        vertices - the number of vertices of the graph
        edges - an Iterable of edges of the graph
        Returns:
        an EdgeList containing no duplicates of edges

      • renameVertices

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E> & java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> Graph<RenamedEdge<T,E>> renameVertices(java.lang.Iterable<E> edges)
        Takes an Iterable of edges and renames the vertices, so that all vertex indices are between 0 and n - 1 where n is the number of vertices
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        Parameters:
        edges - the Iterable whose vertices shall be renamed
        Returns:
        a Graph representing the graph but with renamed edges

      • lightestEdgePerVertex

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E> & java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> java.util.Set<E> lightestEdgePerVertex(int vertices,
                                                                                                                       java.lang.Iterable<E> edges)
        Takes a graph specified by the number of vertices and an Iterable of edges. For each vertex we take the outgoing edge with smallest weight and return a Set of all of these edges
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        Parameters:
        vertices - the number of vertices of the graph
        edges - an Iterable of edges of the graph
        Returns:
        a Set containing only the lightest edge per vertex

      • contract

        public static <T,S,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E> & java.lang.Comparable<? super E>,D extends DirectedEdge<S,D>> Graph<ContractedEdge<T,E>> contract(int vertices,
                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.Iterable<D> span,
                                                                                                                                                  java.lang.Iterable<E> edges)
        Contracts a graph specified by the number of vertices and an Iterable of edges along the edges given by the Iterable span. Each group of vertices that is connected by some of the edges of span will be replaced by a single vertex in the contracted graph.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        S - the weight type of the edges along which we contract
        D - the edge type of the edges along which we contract
        Parameters:
        vertices - the number of vertices in the graph
        span - an Iterable along which the graph shall be contracted
        edges - an Iterable of edges of the graph
        Returns:
        the contracted graph as a Graph

      • flatten

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E> & java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> EdgeList<ContractedEdge<T,E>> flatten(EdgeList<ContractedEdge<T,ContractedEdge<T,E>>> list)
        Takes an EdgeList of at least doubly contracted edges and removes the second-outermost layer of contracted edges
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        Parameters:
        list - the EdgeList of at least doubly contracted edges
        Returns:
        the flattened list of edges as an EdgeList

      • flatten

        public static <T,E extends DirectedEdge<T,E> & java.lang.Comparable<? super E>> Graph<ContractedEdge<T,E>> flatten(Graph<ContractedEdge<T,ContractedEdge<T,E>>> graph)
        Takes a Graph of at least doubly contracted edges and removes the second-outermost layer of contracted edges
        Type Parameters:
        T - the weight type of the edges of the graph
        E - the edge type of the edges of the graph
        Parameters:
        graph - the Graph of at least doubly contracted edges
        Returns:
        the flattened Graph
